intro: Leucocroton saxicola, commonly known as the rock leucocroton, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
